intro: Chaetocalyx belizensis, commonly known as the Belize hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Belize. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. The plant has sturdy, woody stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
